definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Price is soaring. If it goes on like this, we shall not be able to keep the pot boiling.
sentences.chinese: 物價直線上升，這樣子下去，我們都快要揭不開鍋了。

sentences.english: They cheered and cheered. The hall seemed boiling.
sentences.chinese: 他們歡呼雀躍，大廳裏像開鍋了似的。

sentences.english: Wait until the broth boils before adding some eggs.
A: Under such harsh economic downturns, working class can hardly make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 經濟下滑這麼厲害，工薪階層快要揭不開鍋了。

sentences.english: Price is soaring . If it goes on like this, we shall not be able to keep the pot boiling.
sentences.chinese: 物價直線上升，這樣子下去，我們都快要接不開鍋了。

sentences.english: It was like the whole sea bursting open.
sentences.chinese: 簡直象整個大海都開鍋啦。

sentences.english: Under such harsh economic downturns, working class can hardly make ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 經濟下滑這麼厲害，工薪階層快要揭不開鍋了。

sentences.english: How long does it take to boil?
If it goes on like this, we shall not be able to keep the pot boiling.
sentences.chinese: 物價直線上升，這樣子下去，我們都快要接不開鍋了。

sentences.english: The end in the home must be uncovered not boil, 2 child are clamouring look for dad to want to eat.
sentences.chinese: 家裏窮得揭不開鍋，二娃吵嚷着找爹爹要喫的。

sentences.english: When the broth comes to a boil, add the uncooked pasta and stir everything together.
sentences.chinese: 開鍋以後，把生的意麪倒進去，一起攪一攪。
